meanings.definition: Deserving or causing public disgrace or shame.
meanings.sent1: The criminal's ignominious actions were seen by everyone in the town.
meanings.sent2: The team's ignominious defeat was broadcast on live television.
meanings.sent3: It was quite ignominious when he tripped over his own shoelaces in front of his crush.
meanings.sent4: The politician's ignominious fall from grace shocked the entire nation.
meanings.sent5: The student felt the weight of an ignominious failure after forgetting the answer in front of the class.

meanings.sent1: Her ignominious behavior at the party embarrassed her friends.
meanings.sent2: The company faced an ignominious scandal that tarnished its reputation.
meanings.sent3: It was an ignominious moment when he accidentally spilled his drink on the host.
meanings.sent4: The once-respected professor's ignominious downfall shocked the academic community.
meanings.sent5: The dog's ignominious act of stealing food from the table left everyone in disbelief.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or deserving ignominy; despicable.
meanings.sent1: The dictator's ignominious rule led to the suffering of his people.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's ignominious past caught up with him when he was arrested.
meanings.sent3: It was an ignominious sight to see the once-proud building now in ruins.
meanings.sent4: The company's ignominious treatment of its employees sparked outrage.
meanings.sent5: The villain's ignominious deeds were finally exposed to the public.
